availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Warren County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Leanor Walters Dishman on October 4, 1854. Father of Luella Dishman, Fannie Dishman, Fhebe G. Dishman, Granville Dishman, Mary Dishman, and Nancy Dishman. Laborer in Warren County in 1850. Household owned three enslaved persons in Warren County in 1850. Farmer in Warren County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 2, p. 72B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 2.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 1, p. 100.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, Covington Precinct, p. 49.
Marriage Records: Kentucky Marriages, (Richmond, KY: Madison County Courthouse), film no. 000242961, p. 628.
Find A Grave, "John Dishman (1833-1917)," Memorial #94094558, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/94094558# (accessed August 17, 2018).
